content: helical hat - free pattern learn helical knitting by making this perfectly striped hat excellent for stashbusting partial skeins of worsted/ aran yarn yarn worsted/aran weight - 120-130 yards or 60g mc main color including extra thick brim - 60-70 yards or 30g cc contrasting color total < 100g needles - 3 75mm us size 5 - 4mm us size 6 16 inch circular needles or longer for magic loop method gauge - 10 sts x 14 row = 2 on larger needles blocked unisex adult/teen 23 5 finished circumference directions normal brim using mc and smaller needle cast on 112 stitches join in the round pm to mark bor and work 2x2 rib k2 p2 until piece measures 1 5 inches from the cast on edge extra thick brim see tutorial link below using mc and smaller needle cast on 112 stitches with provisional cast on make sure all loops on the needle are your main yarn not cast on yarn then join in the round pm to mark bor and work 2x2 k2 p2 rib for 4 inches next remove the marker and fold the piece in half matching the provisional cast-on up to the needles use another circular needle any length to carefully pick up each stitch while undoing the provisional cast on once there are stitches on both needles match up the needles at both ends and knit the loops together using the empty needle original gauge one used for cast on and ribbing once finished replace stitch marker it is almost like the three-needle bind off except there is no bind off it just seams the top and bottom of the ribbing together to create an extra thick stretchy and seamless brim verypink knits tutorial extremely helpful https //www youtube com/watch v=chxvvw_ekxi helical stripes for hat body after finishing the brim of your choice switch to larger needles and knit one round even at bor without breaking mc join cc and knit to 3 sts before marker *slip 3 sts pick up mc and knit until 3 sts before color change slip 3 sts pick up cc and keep knitting until 3 sts before color change * the point of color change will go back three stitches every time a round is finished because we are slipping stitches to great a jogless stripe keep working in this pattern until piece measures 6 5-7 from cast on edge brooklyn tweed helical knitting tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=c7qrehyud-k decreases 1 *k14 pm* 8 times break mc decreases finished with cc 2 ssk k to 2 sts before marker then k2tog sm ssk k to 2 sts before marker 7 times k2tog 3 k all sts repeat rounds 2 and 3 until 16 sts remain break cc leaving 6-7 tail using darning needle transfer stitches off needles onto yarn tail and secure with extra stitching weave in ends block and enjoy
